title: Pandemic deaths in Ohio and Florida show partisan divide after vaccine rollout
description: The death gap between Democrats and Republicans was larger in counties with lower vaccination rates.

title: How developers will test their apps before Vision Pro launches
description: Apple opened up access to three ways to test apps on real hardware.

title: FCC chair: Speed standard of 25Mbps down, 3Mbps up isn’t good enough anymore
description: Chair proposes 100Mbps national standard and an evaluation of broadband prices.

title: Mass extinction event 260 million years ago resulted from climate change, studies say
description: Ocean stagnation, ecosystem collapses, and volcano eruptions all played a role.

title: Musk plans Supreme Court appeal after losing bid to terminate SEC settlement
description: Supreme Court is Musk's last option as judges uphold limits on his Tesla tweets.

title: Android 4.4 KitKat is truly dead, loses Play Services support
description: With Play Services gone, it's only a matter of time before you can't log in.

title: Encryption-breaking, password-leaking bug in many AMD CPUs could take months to fix
description: "Zenbleed" bug affects all Zen 2-based Ryzen, Threadripper, and EPYC CPUs.

title: Climatologists: July’s intense heat “exactly what we expected to see”
description: Deadly temperatures will become common unless greenhouse gas emissions are cut fast.

title: GM announces a new Ultium-based Chevrolet Bolt during Q2 report
description: The much-loved affordable EV looked finished, but Chevy will build Bolt 2.0.

title: Researchers find deliberate backdoor in police radio encryption algorithm
description: Vendors knew all about it, but most customers were clueless.

title: Catching up with Foundation S2 as the Second Crisis unfolds
description: The second season has faster pacing, more linear storytelling, and bits of levity.
